Name: Babaef
Comment: Also known as Khnumbaf . He was a vizier during the reign of king Shepseskaf . He was probably the son of the vizier Duaenre

Name: Bakenkhonsu
Comment: From the time of pharaoh Ramesses II

Name: Bakenranef
Comment: Also known as Bocchoris . Was briefly a king of the 24th dynasty of Egypt . Based at Sais in the western Delta . Captured and executed by Shabaka , a king of the 25th dynasty

Name: Bakenrenef
Comment: From the time of pharaoh Psamtik I

Name: Baketwernel
Comment: Great Royal Wife of Ramesses IX

Name: Baqet III
Comment: From the time of pharaoh Mentuhotep II

Name: Baskakeren
Comment: King of Kush ( reigned c. 405 BC - c. 404 BC ) and was probably a son of King Malewiebamani and the younger brother of King Amanineteyerike . He succeeded Amanineteyerike to the throne

Name: Baufra
Comment: Also known as Baufre or Bauefre . Baufra was a son of Pharaoh Khufu

Name: Bay Irsu
Comment: Served under pharaoh Seti II and later became an influential powerbroker in the closing stages of the 19th dynasty . Executed

Name: Bebi
Comment: Egyptian vizier under king Mentuhotep II

Name: Bebiankh
Comment: Also known as Seuserenre Bebiankh . The successor of king Semenre

Name: Bebnum
Date: fl . c. early to mid 17th century BC
Comment: Obscur ruler of Lower or Upper Egypt during the Second Intermediate Period . Only known from the Turin King List

Name: Behenu
Comment: She is thought to have been the wife of either Pepi I or of Pepi II

Name: Bek ( or Bak )
Comment: Chief royal sculptor during the reign of Pharaoh Akhenaten . Bek followed the king to Akhetaten , the city founded by Akhenaten . He oversaw the construction of the great temple statues of the king

Name: Beketamun
Comment: Also known as Beket . A daughter of Pharaoh Thutmose III

Name: Beketaten
Comment: She was the youngest daughter of Pharaoh Amenhotep III and Tiye and thus the sister of Pharaoh Akhenaten

Name: Benerib
Comment: Benerib was most likely a wife of pharaoh Hor-Aha , but she was not the mother of his heir , Djer

Name: Berenice
Comment: Also known as Berenice Syra . Daughter of the Egyptian king Ptolemy II Philadelphus and Arsinoe I . She married the Seleucid monarch Antiochus II Theos who divorced his wife , Laodice I . When Antiochus II died , Berenice claimed the regency for her son , Seleucus . However , both Berenice and her son were then killed by Laodice I

Name: Berenice I
Comment: A Macedonian noblewoman who , through her marriage to Ptolemy I Soter , became the first queen of the Ptolemaic dynasty of Egypt . Berenice travelled to Egypt as a lady-in-waiting to Eurydice , Ptolemy I 's wife . Ptolemy I married Berenice in 317 BC

Name: Berenice II
Comment: The daughter of Magas of Cyrene and Queen Apama II . Her husband , Demetrius the Fair , a Macedonian prince , moved to Cyrene where he became the lover of her mother Apama . So Berenice had him killed in Apama 's bedroom . Afterwards she married the Egyptian king , Ptolemy III Euergetes
